ARABIC: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We sent a single Blast against them and they were just like a thatcher's reeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We sent a single blast against them, and they were reduced to husks of a decayed fence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Behold, We sent a single Blast against them, and they became like the trampled twigs of a sheep pen-builder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We sent upon them a single blast of sound and they were left like hay to be used by the cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed We sent upon them a single Scream – thereupon they became like the barrier builder’s residual dry trampled hay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We sent against them a single Sayhah, and they became like straw Al-Muhtazir.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We sent upon them a single cry, so they were like the dry fragments of trees which the maker of an enclosure collects.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We loosed against them one Cry, and they were as the wattles of a pen-builder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We sent upon them one Shout, and they became as the dry twigs (rejected by) the builder of a cattle-fold.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then We sent a single blast against them and they became like dry stubble which has been trampled upon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We We sent upon them one shout, and they became as the stubble of a fold-builder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We sent against them a single Cry, and they became like the dry sticks of a corral builder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We sent against them a single Saihah (torment - awful cry, etc.), and they became like the dry stubble of a fold-builder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then We sent against them one Shout and they became like the trampled twigs of the (sheep) penbuilder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We sent against them a single Scream, and they became like crushed hay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast from the sky, and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:31] Indeed We unleashed upon them a single Cry, and they became like the chaff of a corral builder (almuhtazir is one who makes a pen from dried tree-branches and thorns for his sheep, to protect them from wolves and beasts of prey; the fallen parts which they tread are called hashīm).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! We sent upon them one Shout) the shout of Gabriel three days after the killing of the she-camel, (and they became as the dry twigs (rejected by) the builder of a cattle fold) they became like the things in the cattle fold on which the cattle step.
